content: I want to see a CFO bump down to a designer’s salary and see if they still want to call themselves a “designer” after that. As a couple of people above have already commented, making design decisions does not make you a designer. Makes you a well-intentioned and valuable collaborator (assuming you’re not an asshole to the design team) but not a designer. When designers make copy edits, does that make us copy writers or editors? No. When we estimate budgets, does that make us financial experts? No. We didn’t study or train for these things, and that’s ok. The CFO and copy editor didn’t train in design, and that’s ok too. A successful team can’t have everyone calling themselves the same thing. A successful team is an amalgamation of people with different skills who know their own strengths and weaknesses. On a successful team, my weakness is someone else’s strength and vice versa. And that’s ok. More than ok.
